<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>329<br><h1> 牧 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/牧%20%23kanji">Breed</a></h1>When it is time to breed new cattle、 the bull is usually willing but the cow is often not。 Thus the taskmaster to the right forces the cow into a compromising position、 so to speak、 so that she and her mate can breed。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/牧 ぼく">ボク</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/牧 まき">まき</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>330<br><h1> 攻 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/攻%20%23kanji">Aggression</a></h1>The special craft of successful taskmasters is their ability to remain constantly on the aggressive、 never allowing their underlings a moment to ponder a counter－aggression。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/攻 こう">コウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/攻せめる">せ－める</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>331<br><h1> 敗 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敗%20%23kanji">Failure</a></h1>The taskmaster is acknowledging the failure of a clam to make the grade in some marine school or other。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敗 はい">ハイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敗やぶれる">やぶ－れる</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>332<br><h1> 枚 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/枚%20%23kanji">A sheet of</a></h1>English counts thin、 flat objects、 like bed linen and paper、 in sheets。 The kanji does this with a taskmaster whipping a tree into producing sheets against its will。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/枚 まい">マイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>333<br><h1> 故 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/故%20%23kanji">Happenstance</a></h1>Call it fate or providence or plain old Lady Luck、 happenstance is the oldest taskmaster we know。 It nearly always has its way。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/故 こ">コ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/故 ゆえ">ゆえ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>334<br><h1> 敬 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敬%20%23kanji">Awe</a></h1>Standing in awe of someone、 you get self－conscious and may try to speak in flowery phrases out of veneration or fear。 The task master at the right is drilling you in the practice of your “honorifics。”<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敬 けい">ケイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敬うやまう">うやま－う</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>335<br><h1> 言 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/言%20%23kanji">Say</a></h1>Of all the things we can do with our mouth、 speech requires the greatest distinctness and clarity。 Hence the kanji for say has four little sound－waves、 to show the complexity of the task。  This kanji、 which appears often as a primitive、 can mean saying、 speech、 or words、 depending on which is most useful。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/言 げん">ゲン</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/言 ごん">ゴン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/言いう">い－う</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/言 こと">こと</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>336<br><h1> 警 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/警%20%23kanji">Admonish</a></h1>Here you have a perfect example of how an apparently impossible snarl of strokes becomes a snap to learn once you know its elements。 The idea of being admonished for something already sets up a superior－inferior relationship between you and the person you are supposed to stand in awe of。 While you are restricted to answering in honorifics、 the superior can use straightforward and ordinary words。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/警 けい">ケイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>337<br><h1> 計 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/計%20%23kanji">Plot</a></h1>Words and a meter’s needle combine to form the sense of plot： to talk over plans and to calculate a course of action。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/計 けい">ケイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/計はかる">はか－る</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/計はからう">はか－らう</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>338<br><h1> 獄 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/獄%20%23kanji">Prison</a></h1>Although we did not make note of it at the time、 the kanji for dog is also a low－grade term for a spy。 And later （frame 1414 犯） we will meet another association of criminals with dogs。 The prison here depicts a pack of wild dogs （the long－timers and hardened criminals） into which the poor little chihuahua （firstoff ender） has been cast。 The only thing he has to protect himself against the pack are his shrill and frightened words。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/獄 ごく">ゴク</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>339<br><h1> 訂 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訂%20%23kanji">Revise</a></h1>After completing the first draft 、 you revise it by nailing down your words and “hammering” them into shape。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訂 てい">テイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>340<br><h1> 討 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/討%20%23kanji">Chastise</a></h1>Words spoken to chastise us stick to us like glue in a way no other words can。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/討 とう">トウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/討うつ">う－つ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>341<br><h1> 訓 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訓%20%23kanji">Instruction</a></h1>The personalism connoted by the word instruction、 as opposed to “teaching” or “discipline、” suits the picture here of words guiding one’s progress like the gentle flowing of a stream。 Even the etymology of the word instruction suggests the sense of “pouring into”。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訓 くん">クン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>342<br><h1> 詔 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詔%20%23kanji">Imperial edict</a></h1>The imperial edict、 spoken with the force of unquestionable law、 is made up of words intended to seduce the masses—be it through fear or respect—to follow obediently。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詔 しょう">ショウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詔 みことのり">みことのり</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>343<br><h1> 詰 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詰%20%23kanji">Packed</a></h1>A piece of writing that is pregnant with meaning and needs to be reread several times to be understood we refer to colloquially as “packed。” The character sees the words as sealed tightly inside an aerosol can。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詰 きつ">キツ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詰つめる">つ－める</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詰つまる">つ－まる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詰つむ">つ－む</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>344<br><h1> 話 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/話%20%23kanji">Tale</a></h1>That the words of the tongue should come to mean a tale is clear from the etymology： a tale is something “talked、” not something read from a book。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/話 わ">ワ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/話はなす">はな－す</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/話 はなし">はなし</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>345<br><h1> 詠 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詠%20%23kanji">Recitation</a></h1>Listening to the words of poets reciting their poetry is like being transported for a moment into eternity where the rules of everyday life have been suspended。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詠 えい">エイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詠よむ">よ－む</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>346<br><h1> 詩 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詩%20%23kanji">Poem</a></h1>Since silence is treasured so highly at a Buddhist temple the words spoken there must be well chosen。 Perhaps this is why the records of the monks often read to us like poems。 Before going on、 back up a frame and make sure you have kept poem and recitation distinct in your mind。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詩 し">シ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>347<br><h1> 語 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/語%20%23kanji">Word</a></h1>Whereas the character for say focused on the actual talking、 the kanji for words stresses the fact that although it is I who say them、 the words of a language are not my own。 You can see the clear distinction between I and words just by looking at the kanji。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/語 ご">ゴ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/語かたる">かた－る</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/語かたらう">かた－らう</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>348<br><h1> 読 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読%20%23kanji">Read</a></h1>In the age of advertising、 most words we read are out to sell some product or point of view。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読 どく">ドク</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読 とく">トク</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読 とう">トウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読よむ">よ－む</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>349<br><h1> 調 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調%20%23kanji">Tune</a></h1>A complete tune is composed not only of a succession of notes but also of one lap of the words that go with it。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調 ちょう">チョウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調しらべる">しら－べる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調ととのう">ととの－う</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調ととのえる">ととの－える</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>350<br><h1> 談 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/談%20%23kanji">Discuss</a></h1>In almost every attempt to discuss an issue、 the fervor of one’s convictions comes to the surface and creates an inflammation of words （if you will、 the “cuss” in discuss）。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/談 だん">ダン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>351<br><h1> 諾 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諾%20%23kanji">Consent</a></h1>The words of the young do not have legal validity unless backed up by “parental consent。”<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諾 だく">ダク</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>352<br><h1> 諭 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諭%20%23kanji">Rebuke</a></h1>The stern tone of a rebuke is seen here in the image of words spoken at a meeting of butchers （see frame 289 輸） waving their choppers at one another and “cutting one another down” as only butchers can。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諭 ゆ">ユ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諭さとす">さと－す</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>353<br><h1> 式 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/式%20%23kanji">Style</a></h1>Take style in its sense of some fashion design or model。 Then let the element arrow and craft stand for the well－known style of shirts known as “Arrow shirts” because of the little arrow sewn on each one。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/式 しき">シキ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>354<br><h1> 試 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/試%20%23kanji">Test</a></h1>When a manufacturer produces a new style for the market、 the first thing that is done is to run a test on consumers、 asking them to speak their opinions frankly about the product。 Never mind the anachronism （the kanji was there well before our capitalistic market system） if it helps you remember。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/試 し">シ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/試こころみる">こころ－みる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/試ためす">ため－す</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>355<br><h1> 弐 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弐%20%23kanji">Ii（two）</a></h1> We use the Roman numeral ii here to stress that this kanji is an older form of the kanji for two。 Think of two arrows in a quiver、 standing up like the numeral ii。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弐 に">ニ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>356<br><h1> 域 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/域%20%23kanji">Range</a></h1>From its original meaning of a defined area or zone、 a range has also come to mean a grazing land where cowboys roam and do whatever it is they do with cows。 When the herds have all been driven to market、 there is a great homecoming fiesta like that pictured here。 As soon as the cowboys come home、 home on the range、 the first thing they do is kiss the ground （the mouth on the ）、 and then get on with the fiesta。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/域 いき">イキ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>357<br><h1> 賊 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賊%20%23kanji">Burglar</a></h1>From a burglar’s point of view、 a fiesta is an occasion to take out the old lockpicking needle and break into the unattended safe filled with the family shells （the old form of money、 as we saw in frames 80 and 194）。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賊 ぞく">ゾク</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>358<br><h1> 栽 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/栽%20%23kanji">Plantation</a></h1>On a fruit plantation it is the trees that one is particularly grateful for at the time of Thanksgiving。 Imagine yourself inviting a few representative trees from the fields and orchards to join you around the table to give thanks。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/栽 さい">サイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>359<br><h1> 載 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/載%20%23kanji">Load</a></h1>One loads bales on a wagon or cart in preparation for the great Hay Ride that follows the Thanksgiving dinner each year。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/載 さい">サイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/載のせる">の－せる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/載のる">の－る</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>360<br><h1> 茂 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茂%20%23kanji">Overgrown</a></h1>The sense of the key word overgrown is of something growing luxuriously、 though not necessarily in excess—in this case a whole parade of weeds （outcaste flowers）。 By way of exception、 the flowers take their normal place over the enclosure。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茂 も">モ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茂しげる">しげ－る</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>361<br><h1> 成 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成%20%23kanji">Turn into</a></h1>Let the phrase “turn into” suggest some sort of a magical change。 What happens here is that the parade marching down main street turns into a dagger－throwing bout between competing bands。 Note how only one stroke has to be added to make the change。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成 せい">セイ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成 じょう">ジョウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成なる">な－る</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成なす">な－す</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>362<br><h1> 城 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/城%20%23kanji">Castle</a></h1>In this frame、 we see a mound of dirt that is being turned into a castle （the way you may have done as a child playing on the beach）。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/城 じょう">ジョウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/城 しろ">しろ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>363<br><h1> 誠 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誠%20%23kanji">Sincerity</a></h1>The sure sign of sincerity is that one’s mere words are turned into deeds。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誠 せい">セイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誠 まこと">まこと</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>364<br><h1> 威 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/威%20%23kanji">Intimidate</a></h1>Here we see a march of women demonstrating on behalf of equal rights、 something extremely intimidating to the male chauvinist population。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/威 い">イ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>365<br><h1> 滅 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滅%20%23kanji">Destroy</a></h1>Picture a march of flames demonstrating against the Fire Department for their right to destroy、 but being doused with water by the police riot squads。 <br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滅 めつ">メツ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滅ほろびる">ほろ－びる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滅ほろぼす">ほろ－ぼす</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>366<br><h1> 減 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/減%20%23kanji">Dwindle</a></h1>A group of unquenchable mouths sets out on a march across the country、 drinking water wherever they can find it until the water supply has dwindled to a trickle、 triggering a national disaster。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/減 げん">ゲン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/減へる">へ－る</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/減へらす">へ－らす</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>367<br><h1> 桟 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/桟%20%23kanji">Scaff old</a></h1>Prior to the use of metal、 trees were once cut down and bound together for use as scaff olding material。 In the case of the kanji shown here、 what is being constructed is not a skyscraper but a simple float。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/桟 さん">サン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>368<br><h1> 銭 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/銭%20%23kanji">Coin</a></h1>Those special gold－colored tokens minted each year for the Mardi Gras and thrown into the crowds from people on the floats give us the kanji for coins。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/銭 せん">セン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/銭 ぜに">ぜに</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>369<br><h1> 浅 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/浅%20%23kanji">Shallow</a></h1>An entourage of floats going from one town to the next must always seek a shallow place to cross the water。 Try to picture what happens if they don’t。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/浅 せん">セン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/浅あさい">あさ－い</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>370<br><h1> 止 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/止%20%23kanji">Stop</a></h1>The character for stop is easiest to learn as a pictograph、 though you have to take a moment to see it。 Take it as a rather crude drawing of a footprint： the first 3 strokes represent the front of the foot and the last the heel。 The big toe （stroke 2 sticking out to the right） on the right indicates that this is a left foot。  Although the meaning of stop will be retained、we will return often to the pictographic meaning of footprint。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/止 し">シ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/止とまる">と－まる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/止とめる">と－める</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>371<br><h1> 歩 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩%20%23kanji">Walk</a></h1>Footprints that follow one another a few at a time indicate walking。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩 ほ">ホ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩 ぶ">ブ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩 ふ">フ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩あるく">ある－く</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩あゆむ">あゆ－む</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>372<br><h1> 渉 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渉%20%23kanji">Ford</a></h1>To ford a body of water means to walk across it。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渉 しょう">ショウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>373<br><h1> 頻 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頻%20%23kanji">Repeatedly</a></h1>The image of something occurring repeatedly、 over and over again、 is of having one’s head walked on。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頻 ひん">ヒン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>374<br><h1> 肯 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肯%20%23kanji">Agreement</a></h1>Seeing footprints on someone’s flesh indicates a rather brutal way of having secured that person’s agreement。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肯 こう">コウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>375<br><h1> 企 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/企%20%23kanji">Undertake</a></h1>To undertake a project is to take some idea floating in the air and stop it so that it can be brought down to earth and become a reality。 Here we see some undertaking made to stop under a beach umbrella。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/企 き">キ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/企くわだてる">くわだ－てる</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>376<br><h1> 歴 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歴%20%23kanji">Curriculum</a></h1>That same grove of trees we met in frame 213 暦 shows up here in the character for curriculum （in the sense of a record of one’s life or academic achievements、 the curriculum vitae）。 Instead of the grove making its way slowly through the surface of the cliff as before、 here we see it stopped、 much the same as a curriculum vitae calls a halt to the calendar and talks only about the past。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歴 れき">レキ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>377<br><h1> 武 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/武%20%23kanji">Warrior</a></h1>With a quiver of arrows set on one’s back、 the goal of the warrior depicted here is not to attack but merely to stop the attack of others： the oldest excuse in history！<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/武 ぶ">ブ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/武 む">ム</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>378<br><h1> 賦 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賦%20%23kanji">Levy</a></h1>A certain portion of shells （money） is collected by the warrior from the local villages as he passes through to defray the costs of keeping the land safe、 and this is called a levy。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賦 ふ">フ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>379<br><h1> 正 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正%20%23kanji">Correct</a></h1>“A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step、” says the Chinese proverb。 Here we see one footprint、 complementing that proverb with the sound advice that if the first step is not made correctly、 the whole point of the journey will be forfeited。 This is the ideal that teachers are supposed to have in correcting their students、 and parents in correcting their children。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正 せい">セイ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正 しょう">ショウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正ただしい">ただ－しい</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正ただす">ただ－す</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正 まさ">まさ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>380<br><h1> 証 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/証%20%23kanji">Evidence</a></h1>Words that testify to the correctness of some fact are classified as evidence。 （Here we see a good example of how the more common primitive element takes the “strong” position to the left 、 even though it has more strokes。）<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/証 しょう">ショウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>381<br><h1> 政 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/政%20%23kanji">Politics</a></h1>To the many definitions for politics that already exist、 this character off ers yet another： correct taskmastering。 Think about what<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/政 せい">セイ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/政 しょう">ショウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/政 まつりごと">まつりごと</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>382<br><h1> 定 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定%20%23kanji">Determine</a></h1>Determination、 in the sense of settling on a certain course of action、 is likened here to mending one’s house。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定 てい">テイ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定 じょう">ジョウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定さだめる">さだ－める</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定さだまる">さだ－まる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定さだか">さだ－か</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>383<br><h1> 錠 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錠%20%23kanji">Lock</a></h1>Metal of itself doesn’t lock。 It needs to be so determined by a locksmith。 Now make a concrete image of that。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錠 じょう">ジョウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>384<br><h1> 走 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/走%20%23kanji">Run</a></h1>Running、 we are told here、 mends the soil。 Observe in the following frames how this kanji can embrace other elements from below、 much the same way as the element for road does。 Note、 too、 that in order to do this、 the final stroke needs to be lengthened。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/走 そう">ソウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/走はしる">はし－る</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>385<br><h1> 超 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/超%20%23kanji">Transcend</a></h1>When one is running after something、 the goal that seduces one is said to transcend the seeker。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/超 ちょう">チョウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/超こえる">こ－える</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/超こす">こ－す</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>386<br><h1> 赴 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/赴%20%23kanji">Proceed</a></h1>In proceeding to a new city or a new job、 something in you runs ahead with excitement、 and something else holds you back、 like a divining rod built into your psyche warning you to check things out carefully before rushing in too wildly。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/赴 ふ">フ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/赴おもむく">おもむ－く</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>387<br><h1> 越 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/越%20%23kanji">Surpass</a></h1>Here we see two parades in competition、 each trying to surpass the other by running at high speed from one town to the next。 Note the little “hook” at the end of the first stroke of the element for parade。 This is the only time it appears like this in the kanji treated in this book。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/越 えつ">エツ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/越こす">こ－す</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/越こえる">こ－える</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>388<br><h1> 是 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/是%20%23kanji">Justso</a></h1>In this kanji we are shown someone spending an entire day at mending one stocking、 because they want the job done “just so。” Be sure to make a clear image of a finicky old fusspot to make the abstract idea as concrete as possible。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/是 ぜ">ゼ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>389<br><h1> 題 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/題%20%23kanji">Topic</a></h1>In many kinds of research、 one can find information on a given topic only if the headings are prepared just so。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/題 だい">ダイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>390<br><h1> 堤 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堤%20%23kanji">Dike</a></h1>A dike is a successful bit of engineering only if the amount of earth piled up is measured just so for the height and pressure of the water it is meant to contain。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堤 てい">テイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堤 つつみ">つつみ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>391<br><h1> 建 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建%20%23kanji">Build</a></h1>To construct a building、 you first draw a set of plans （the writing brush） and then s－t－r－e－t－c－h your drawing out to scale in reality。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建 けん">ケン</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建 こん">コン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建たてる">た－てる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建たつ">た－つ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>392<br><h1> 延 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延%20%23kanji">Prolong</a></h1>This character is a kind of pictographic image of how prolonging is a clever way of stopping things by trying to stretch them out a little bit at a time （the extra drop at the top of stop）。 Be sure to get a concrete image of this process、 by imagining yourself prolonging something you can really、 physically、 stretch。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延 えん">エン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延のびる">の－びる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延のべる">の－べる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延のばす">の－ばす</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>393<br><h1> 誕 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誕%20%23kanji">Nativity</a></h1>The key word of course calls to mind the feast of Christmas。 As the famous poem at the start of St。 John’s gospel tells us、 the nativity we celebrate at Christmas had its origins at the very start of time and governs all of human history： it represents the prolongation of the eternal Word in time and space。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誕 たん">タン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>394<br><h1> 礎 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/礎%20%23kanji">Cornerstone</a></h1>This character depicts a cornerstone as a stone set at the end of a wildlife preserve （the “zoo in the grove”）。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/礎 そ">ソ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/礎 いしずえ">いしずえ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>395<br><h1> 婿 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/婿%20%23kanji">Bridegroom</a></h1>What makes a man a bridegroom is obviously a woman and her dowry、 here presented as a small zoo （animals were often used for this purpose in earlier societies） and a month away from it all （the “honeymoon”）。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/婿 せい">セイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/婿 むこ">むこ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>396<br><h1> 衣 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衣%20%23kanji">Garment</a></h1>At the top we see the top hat、 and at the bottom a pictographic representation of the folds of a garment。 If you break the “4－fold” fold into 2 sets of 2 strokes、 you will find it easier to remember。  Used as a primitive、 the additional meanings of cloak or scarf will come in handy。 What has to be noted particularly are the changes in shape the kanji can undergo when it becomes an element in other kanji。 In fact、 it is the most volatile of all the kanji we shall treat、 and for that reason deserves special attention here。 When it appears to the left 、 it looks like this： 衤、 and we shall take it to mean cloak。 At the bottom、 when attached to the stroke immediately above it、 the first two strokes （the top hat） are omitted、 giving us： 背、 which we shall take to mean a scarf。 On rare occasions、 the element can be torn right across the middle、 with the first 2 strokes appearing at the top and the last 4 at the bottom of another primitive or cluster of primitives： 胎、 in which cases we shall speak of a top hat and scarf。 And finally、 of course、 it can keep its original kanji shape、 along with its original meaning of garment in general。 Note that when any of the above forms have something beneath them （as in frame 402 遠）、 the third from final stroke is “unhooked、” like this： 胖。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衣 い">イ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衣 ころも">ころも</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>397<br><h1> 裁 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裁%20%23kanji">Tailor</a></h1>You might think here of garments that have been specially tailored for Thanks giving celebrations to look like traditional Pilgrim garb。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裁 さい">サイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裁たつ">た－つ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裁さばく">さば－く</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>398<br><h1> 装 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/装%20%23kanji">Attire</a></h1>The character for attire can be remembered as a picture of what we may call a “turtle－samurai” sweater。 At the top we see the turtle－samurai and at the bottom the element for garment。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/装 そう">ソウ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/装 しょう">ショウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/装よそおう">よそお－う</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>399<br><h1> 裏 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裏%20%23kanji">Back</a></h1>An innocent looking top hat and scarf lying there in front of you、 turned over、 reveal a hidden computer sewn into the back of each—obviously the tools of a master spy。 Such experiences teach one always to have a look at the back side of things。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裏 り">リ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裏 うら">うら</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>400<br><h1> 壊 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壊%20%23kanji">Demolition</a></h1>The right half of this character shows a garment woven so fine that it can pass through the eye of a needle、 fittingly draped around the slithering、 ethereal form of a poltergeist。 In this frame、 our eerie visitor brushes its robes against a nearby block of apartments and completely demolishes them、 razing them to the ground。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壊 かい">カイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壊こわす">こわ－す</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壊こわれる">こわ－れる</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>401<br><h1> 哀 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/哀%20%23kanji">Pathetic</a></h1>A drunken sod in a tattered top hat and soiled silk scarf with a giant mouth guzzling something or other gives us a pathetic character role in which W。 C。 Fields might find himself right at home。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/哀 あい">アイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/哀あわれ">あわ－れ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/哀あわれむ">あわ－れむ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>402<br><h1> 遠 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遠%20%23kanji">Distant</a></h1>A distant figure on the road is such a blur it looks like a lidded crock wearing a silk scarf。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遠 えん">エン</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遠 おん">オン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遠とおい">とお－い</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>403<br><h1> 猿 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/猿%20%23kanji">Monkey</a></h1>This clever little monkey has captured an entire pack of wild dogs、 locked them inside a lidded crock、 and wrapped the whole thing up in a silk scarf to present to the dogcatcher。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/猿 えん">エン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/猿 さる">さる</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>404<br><h1> 初 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初%20%23kanji">First time</a></h1>The primitives here take care of themselves： cloak and dagger。 What I leave to you is to decide on an appropriate connotation for “first time” to take advantage of them。 氿<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初 しょ">ショ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初はじめ">はじ－め</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初はじめて">はじ－めて</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初 はつ">はつ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初 うい">うい</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初そめる">そ－める</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>405<br><h1> 布 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/布%20%23kanji">Linen</a></h1>The maid、 towels by her side、 distributes the linen。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/布 ふ">フ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/布 ぬの">ぬの</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>406<br><h1> 帆 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帆%20%23kanji">Sail</a></h1>A sail made of a towel makes a mediocre vessel。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帆 はん">ハン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帆 ほ">ほ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>407<br><h1> 幅 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幅%20%23kanji">Hanging scroll</a></h1>A towel owned by the wealthiest tycoon in the world is made into a hanging scroll after his death and auctioned off to the highest bidder。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幅 ふく">フク</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幅 はば">はば</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>408<br><h1> 帽 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帽%20%23kanji">Cap</a></h1>Because of the risk involved （of getting the sun in one’s eyes）、 one puts together a makeshift cap out of a dirty old towel。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帽 ぼう">ボウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>409<br><h1> 幕 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幕%20%23kanji">Curtain</a></h1>A dirty towel draped over the entrance to the old graveyard is painted to look like the curtain of death that leads to the other world。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幕 まく">マク</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幕 ばく">バク</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>410<br><h1> 幌 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幌%20%23kanji">Canopy</a></h1>A large towel stretched overhead with only a few of the sun’s rays breaking through represents a canopy over one’s bed。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>411<br><h1> 錦 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錦%20%23kanji">Brocade</a></h1>A strip of white towel and some scraps of metal have the makings of a primitive kind of brocade。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錦 きん">キン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錦 にしき">にしき</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>412<br><h1> 市 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/市%20%23kanji">Market</a></h1>Dressed in nothing but a bath towel and top hat、 one sets off to the marketplace in search of a bargain or two。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/市 し">シ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/市 いち">いち</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>413<br><h1> 姉 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姉%20%23kanji">Eldersister</a></h1>Of all the women of the family、 it is the elder sister who has the duty to go to market to do the shopping。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姉 し">シ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姉 あね">あね</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>414<br><h1> 肺 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肺%20%23kanji">Lungs</a></h1>One is surprised、 strolling through the market、 to find among the meats hung out for sale a slab marked： lungs。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肺 はい">ハイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>415<br><h1> 帯 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帯%20%23kanji">Sash</a></h1>The part of the apron where one finds the buckle （represented pictorially by the first 5 strokes） is on the sash。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帯 たい">タイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帯おびる">お－びる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帯 おび">おび</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>416<br><h1> 滞 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滞%20%23kanji">Stagnate</a></h1>People that have been “sashed” to something （whether their mother’s apron strings or a particular job） for too long become like water that has stopped moving： they start to stagnate。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滞 たい">タイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滞とどこおる">とどこお－る</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>417<br><h1> 刺 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/刺%20%23kanji">Thorn</a></h1>Thorns grow on a bush here that has wrapped itself around a tree like a belt、 cutting into the poor tree like little sabers。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/刺 し">シ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/刺さす">さ－す</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/刺ささる">さ－さる</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>418<br><h1> 制 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/制%20%23kanji">System</a></h1>This kanji show a unique system for leading cows to the slaughterer’s saber： one ties a belt about their waist and fixes that belt to an overhead cable、 pulling the cow up into the air where it hangs suspended、 helpless against the fate that awaits it。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/制 せい">セイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>419<br><h1> 製 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/製%20%23kanji">Made in…</a></h1>A label indicating that a garment was made in u。s。a。 or Taiwan or Japan is itself a symbol for the systematization of the garment industry。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/製 せい">セイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>420<br><h1> 転 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転%20%23kanji">Revolve</a></h1>As the wheels of the car revolve、 they kick up small rising clouds of dust and debris behind them。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転 てん">テン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転ころがる">ころ－がる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転ころげる">ころ－げる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転ころがす">ころ－がす</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転ころぶ">ころ－ぶ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>421<br><h1> 芸 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芸%20%23kanji">Technique</a></h1>The secret technique of making a rising cloud of smoke turn into a bouquet of flowers is shown here。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芸 げい">ゲイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>422<br><h1> 雨 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雨%20%23kanji">Rain</a></h1>This kanji、 also a primitive、 is one of the clearest instances we have of a complex pictograph。 The top line is the sky、 the next 3 strokes a pair of clouds、 and the final 4 dots the rain collected there and waiting to fall。  As a primitive it can mean either rain or weather in general。 Because it takes so much space、 it usually has to be contracted into a crown by shortening the second and third strokes into a crown like this： 胙。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雨 う">ウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雨 あめ">あめ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雨 あま">あま</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>423<br><h1> 雲 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雲%20%23kanji">Cloud</a></h1>Here is the full character for cloud from which the primitive for a rising cloud derives。 Clouds begin with vapors rising up in small clouds from the surface of the earth、 and then gathering to make clouds that eventually dump their rain back on the earth。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雲 うん">ウン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雲 くも">くも</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>424<br><h1> 曇 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曇%20%23kanji">Cloudyweather</a></h1>We refer to days when the sun is covered by the clouds as cloudy weather。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曇 どん">ドン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曇くもる">くも－る</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>425<br><h1> 雷 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雷%20%23kanji">Thunder</a></h1>The full rumble and roar and terror of thunder is best felt not with your head tucked under your pillow safe in bed、 but out in an open rice field where you can get the real feel of the weather。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雷 らい">ライ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雷 かみなり">かみなり</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>426<br><h1> 霜 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霜%20%23kanji">Frost</a></h1>Think of frost as a cooperative venture、 an inter－action of the malevolent forces of weather that sit around a conference table and finally decide to allow a very light amount of moisture to fall just before a short and sudden freeze。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霜 そう">ソウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霜 しも">しも</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>427<br><h1> 冬 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冬%20%23kanji">Winter</a></h1>Walking legs slipping on the ice are a sure sign of winter。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冬 とう">トウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冬 ふゆ">ふゆ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>428<br><h1> 天 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/天%20%23kanji">Heavens</a></h1>This character is meant to be a pictograph of a great man、 said to represent the Lord of the Heavens。 （You may、 of course、 use the elements ceiling and St。 Bernard instead。）  The primitive can mean either the heaven of eternal bliss or the general term for sky、the heavens。 Pay special attention to the fact that in its primitive form the first stroke is written right to left 、 rather like the first stroke of thousand （frame 40 千）、 rather than left to right、 giving us： 夭。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/天 てん">テン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/天 あめ">あめ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/天 あま">あま</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>429<br><h1> 橋 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/橋%20%23kanji">Bridge</a></h1>The bridge shown here is made of trees in their natural form、 except that the trunks have been carved into the forms of angels、 a sort of “Ponte degli Angeli。”<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/橋 きょう">キョウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/橋 はし">はし</a></div>
