<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>430<br><h1> 嬌 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嬌%20%23kanji">Attractive</a></h1>Associating a particularly attractive woman you know with an angel should be no problem。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>431<br><h1> 立 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立%20%23kanji">Stand up</a></h1>This picture of a vase standing up has its meaning extended to represent the general posture of anything standing up。  Used as a primitive、 it can also mean vase。 Using its kanji meaning、 think of something standing up that is normally lying down、 or something standing up in an unusual way。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立 りつ">リツ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立 りゅう">リュウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立たつ">た－つ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立たてる">た－てる</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>432<br><h1> 泣 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泣%20%23kanji">Cry</a></h1>One cries and cries until one is standing up knee－deep in water （or until one has a vase－full of water）。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泣 きゅう">キュウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泣なく">な－く</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>433<br><h1> 章 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/章%20%23kanji">Badge</a></h1>Try to imagine a club badge pinned to your lapel in the form of a mammoth sunflower protruding from a wee little vase。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/章 しょう">ショウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>434<br><h1> 競 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競%20%23kanji">Vie</a></h1>Two teenagers are seen here standing up to one another、 vying for the attention of their peers。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競 きょう">キョウ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競 けい">ケイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競きそう">きそ－う</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競せる">せ－る</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>435<br><h1> 帝 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帝%20%23kanji">Sovereign</a></h1>An uncommon、 but not altogether unlikely picture of a reigning sovereign has him standing up in his apron、 presumably at the behest of his sovereign （she who is to be obeyed）、 who needs help with washing the dishes。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帝 てい">テイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>436<br><h1> 童 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/童%20%23kanji">Juvenile</a></h1>This frame shows up the image of a juvenile hacker standing on top of a computer、 or rather jumping up and down on it、 because it refused to come up with the right answer。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/童 どう">ドウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/童 わらべ">わらべ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>437<br><h1> 瞳 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/瞳%20%23kanji">Pupil</a></h1>Begin with the double meaning of the key word pupil： “student” and the “apple of one’s eye。” Now all you have to do is dwell on the phrase “juvenile of one’s eye” （the meaning here） until it provides you with an image。 <br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/瞳 どう">ドウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/瞳 ひとみ">ひとみ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>438<br><h1> 鐘 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鐘%20%23kanji">Bell</a></h1>This bell is made of cheap metal、 and so badly made that when you ring it、 it lets out a noise like the “bellowing” of juveniles who aren’t getting their own way。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鐘 しょう">ショウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鐘 かね">かね</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>439<br><h1> 商 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/商%20%23kanji">Make a deal</a></h1>See the peddler standing atop his motorcycle helmet as if it were a soapbox、 hawking his wares to passersby。 The legs and mouth represent the tools of the trade of making a deal any way you can。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/商 しょう">ショウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/商あきなう">あきな－う</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>440<br><h1> 嫡 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫡%20%23kanji">Legitimatewife</a></h1>The phrase legitimate wife would have no meaning if there were not such things as “illegitimate wives、” taken because one’s legal woman has turned into an antique。 The very off ense of the idea should help you remember the kanji。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫡 ちゃく">チャク</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>441<br><h1> 適 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/適%20%23kanji">Suitable</a></h1>Can you imagine anything less suitable to do with one’s precious antiques than to display them in the middle of a crowded road－way？<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/適 てき">テキ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>442<br><h1> 滴 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滴%20%23kanji">Drip</a></h1>Picture water dripping on what you thought were precious antiques、 only to find that the artificial aging painted on them is running！<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滴 てき">テキ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滴 しずく">しずく</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滴したたる">したた－る</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>443<br><h1> 敵 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敵%20%23kanji">Enemy</a></h1>Picture your most precious antique （it doesn’t matter how old it really is、 so long as it is the oldest thing you own） being knocked over by your most unlikable taskmaster、 and you have a good picture of how people make themselves enemies for life。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敵 てき">テキ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敵 かたき">かたき</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>444<br><h1> 匕 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匕%20%23kanji">Spoon</a></h1>This character、 a pictograph of a spoon、 is easy enough to remember、 provided you keep it distinct from that for seven、 where the first stroke is written left to right （the opposite of here） and cuts noticeably across the second。  As a primitive、 this kanji can take on the additional meaning of someone sitting on the ground、 of which it can also be considered a pictograph。 In this case、 the second stroke does not cut through the first at all、 as in the following frame。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>445<br><h1> 北 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/北%20%23kanji">North</a></h1>The cold air from the north is so strong that we see two people sitting on the ground back to back、 their arms interlocked so they don’t blow away。 （Pay special attention to the drawing of the first 3 strokes。） <br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/北 ほく">ホク</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/北 きた">きた</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>446<br><h1> 背 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背%20%23kanji">Stature</a></h1>One’s stature is measured according to the “northern－most” part of the body。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背 はい">ハイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背 せ">せ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背 せい">せい</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背そむく">そむ－く</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背そむける">そむ－ける</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>447<br><h1> 比 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/比%20%23kanji">Compare</a></h1>With two spoons、 one in each hand、 you are comparing your mother’s cooking with your mother－in－law’s。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/比 ひ">ヒ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/比くらべる">くら－べる</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>448<br><h1> 昆 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/昆%20%23kanji">Descendants</a></h1>By comparing apes with anthropoids、 we not only discover the latter have descended from those progenitors educated in the higher branches、 but that the very idea of seeing everything descended from everything else、 one way or another、 means that there is “nothing new under the sun。”<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/昆 こん">コン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>449<br><h1> 皆 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皆%20%23kanji">All</a></h1>Think of the housewives in tv commercials “comparing the whiteness” of their laundry across the fence、 a typical advertisement for the popular detergent known as All。 （If you don’t know the brand、 surely you’ve heard the phrases “all－purpose detergent” or “all－temperature detergent。”）<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皆 かい">カイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皆 みな">みな</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>450<br><h1> 混 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混%20%23kanji">Mix</a></h1>Mixed marriages、 this character suggests、 water down the quality of one’s descendants—the oldest racial nonsense in the world！<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混 こん">コン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混まじる">ま－じる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混まざる">ま－ざる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混まぜる">ま－ぜる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混こむ">こ－む</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>451<br><h1> 渇 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渇%20%23kanji">Thirst</a></h1>As you pass by the muchacho taking the siesta、 he cries out that he is thirsty and asks for something to drink。 So you turn the water hose on him。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渇 かつ">カツ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渇かわく">かわ－く</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>452<br><h1> 謁 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謁%20%23kanji">Audience</a></h1>Imagine an audience with the emperor or the pope in which all those in attendance are sitting down、 leaning against the wall、 sleeping like our muchacho on siesta、 as the honorable host delivers his speech。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謁 えつ">エツ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>453<br><h1> 褐 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/褐%20%23kanji">Brown</a></h1>The color of the serape or cloak of our muchacho on siesta is a dull brown、 the color this kanji indicates。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/褐 かつ">カツ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>454<br><h1> 喝 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喝%20%23kanji">Hoarse</a></h1>When the muchacho on siesta looks up and opens his mouth to talk、 his voice is so hoarse you cannot understand him。 <br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喝 かつ">カツ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>455<br><h1> 旨 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旨%20%23kanji">Delicious</a></h1>Something is so downright delicious that one spends the entire day with a spoon in hand gobbling it up。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旨 し">シ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旨 むね">むね</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>456<br><h1> 脂 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脂%20%23kanji">Fat</a></h1>This kanji tells us that if you feed the flesh with too many delicious things、 it soon picks up a thick layer of fat。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脂 し">シ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脂 あぶら">あぶら</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>457<br><h1> 壱 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壱%20%23kanji">I（one）</a></h1>The Roman numeral i—like that for ii we met earlier in frame 355 弐—is only rarely used now。 In the midst of all the samurai、 we notice one in particular sitting on the ground with a crown on his head、 indicating that he is “number i” in the current rankings。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壱 いち">イチ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>458<br><h1> 毎 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毎%20%23kanji">Every</a></h1>“Behind every successful person lies a woman…、” who usually turns out to be one’s mama！<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毎 まい">マイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>459<br><h1> 敏 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敏%20%23kanji">Cleverness</a></h1>Behind every successful taskmaster、 the cleverness of a fox to outwit his charges。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敏 びん">ビン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>460<br><h1> 梅 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/梅%20%23kanji">Plum</a></h1>Behind every Jack Horner’s pie maker、 a tree full of plums。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/梅 ばい">バイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/梅 うめ">うめ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>461<br><h1> 海 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/海%20%23kanji">Sea</a></h1>Behind every drop of water、 a sea from which it originated。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/海 かい">カイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/海 うみ">うみ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>462<br><h1> 乞 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乞%20%23kanji">Beg</a></h1>See someone lying down in a public place with a hook in place of a hand、 begging a morsel of rice or a few pence。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乞こう">こ－う</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>463<br><h1> 乾 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乾%20%23kanji">Drought</a></h1>In times of drought anything at all will do。 Here we see the victims begging for just a little mist for relief。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乾 かん">カン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乾かわく">かわ－く</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乾かわかす">かわ－かす</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>464<br><h1> 腹 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/腹%20%23kanji">Abdomen</a></h1>If you double back （fold over） most animals—or people、 for that matter—in the middle、 the part of the body where the crease comes is the abdomen。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/腹 ふく">フク</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/腹 はら">はら</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>465<br><h1> 複 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/複%20%23kanji">Duplicate</a></h1>In its original and etymologically transparent sense、 to duplicate something means to double it back with a fold、 like the fold of a cloak。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/複 ふく">フク</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>466<br><h1> 欠 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/欠%20%23kanji">Lack</a></h1>The pictograph hidden in this character is of someone yawning。 The first stroke shows the head thrown back； the second、 the arm bent at the elbow as the hand reaches up to cover the mouth； and the last two、 the legs。 Since yawning shows a lack of something （psychologically、 interest； physiologically、 sleep）、 the connection is plain to see。  When used as a primitive element、 this kanji can mean either yawn or lack。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/欠 けつ">ケツ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/欠かける">か－ける</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/欠かく">か－く</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>467<br><h1> 吹 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吹%20%23kanji">Blow</a></h1>To blow is really no more than a deliberate eff ort to make one’s mouth lack all the air that is in it。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吹 すい">スイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吹ふく">ふ－く</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>468<br><h1> 炊 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/炊%20%23kanji">Cook</a></h1>Better to picture what happens when you do not pay attention to your work in the kitchen。 Here we see a blazing fire and an inattentive、 yawning cook who let things get out of control。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/炊 すい">スイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/炊たく">た－く</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>469<br><h1> 歌 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歌%20%23kanji">Song</a></h1>The song in this kanji is being sung by a chorus line of can－can girls。 Why it should be eliciting nothing but yawning from the audience、 I leave to you to decide。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歌 か">カ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歌 うた">うた</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歌うたう">うた－う</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>470<br><h1> 軟 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/軟%20%23kanji">Soft</a></h1>If the cushions of one’s car are too soft、 one may begin yawning at the wheel。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/軟 なん">ナン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/軟やわらか">やわ－らか</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/軟やわらかい">やわ－らかい</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>471<br><h1> 次 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次%20%23kanji">Next</a></h1>This key word connotes the “next in line” of a succession of people or things。 Let there be a lack of ice on the hottest day of summer、 and you stand impatiently in line waiting for the distributor to call out “Next！”  As a primitive、 this character can either retain its key word meaning of next or the related meaning of second。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次 じ">ジ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次 し">シ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次つぐ">つ－ぐ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次 つぎ">つぎ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>472<br><h1> 茨 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茨%20%23kanji">Briar</a></h1>Earlier we made mention of the story of Briar Rose （or “Sleeping Beauty、” as we called her in frame 154 垣） and drew attention to the briar hedge that grew up all about her castle。 But in the second part of the story、 these briars blossomed into flowers。 Hence her name、 Briar Rose。 Be careful not to confuse this character with that for thorn （frame 417 刺）。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茨 いばら">いばら</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>473<br><h1> 資 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/資%20%23kanji">Assets</a></h1>The first shells （money） you earn、 you use to pay your debts。 From then on、 the next shells you accumulate become your assets。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/資 し">シ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>474<br><h1> 姿 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姿%20%23kanji">Figure</a></h1>This kanji depicts a woman’s figure as a sort of second self。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姿 し">シ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姿 すがた">すがた</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>475<br><h1> 諮 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諮%20%23kanji">Consultwith</a></h1>To seek the words of a second mouth is to consult with someone about something。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諮 し">シ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諮はかる">はか－る</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>476<br><h1> 賠 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賠%20%23kanji">Compensation</a></h1>Picture a clam used as a muzzle to quiet the complaints of a fisherman’s widow asking compensation for her husband lost at sea。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賠 ばい">バイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>477<br><h1> 培 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/培%20%23kanji">Cultivate</a></h1>The barrel hoops used by many Japanese farmers to stretch clear plastic over row of vegetables in a garden patch in the hopes of cultivating bigger and bigger vegetables is a way of muzzling the soil。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/培 ばい">バイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/培つちかう">つちか－う</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>478<br><h1> 剖 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/剖%20%23kanji">Divide</a></h1>To “divide and conquer” you use a saber and a muzzle。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/剖 ぼう">ボウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>479<br><h1> 音 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音%20%23kanji">Sound</a></h1>The kanji for sound depicts something standing in the air over a tongue wagging in a mouth、 much the same as a sound does for the briefest of moments before disappearing。  The primitive from this kanji also means simply a sound。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音 おん">オン</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音 いん">イン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音 おと">おと</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音 ね">ね</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>480<br><h1> 暗 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暗%20%23kanji">Darkness</a></h1>When “darkness covered the earth” at the beginning of time、 there was neither sun nor sound。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暗 あん">アン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暗くらい">くら－い</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>481<br><h1> 韻 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韻%20%23kanji">Rhyme</a></h1>Poetry restricted to verses that rhyme often finds it has to abandon clarity of thought in order to make the rhyme of the words work。 In this kanji’s picture、 one becomes a kind of “soundemployee。”  ┷ kazoo This primitive’s special usefulness lies not in its frequency but in its simplification of a few otherwise difficult kanji。 It pictures the sound of a fiesta、 namely a kazoo。 Note how the element for sound is written first、 the fifth stroke extended so that it can be used in the element for fiesta。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韻 いん">イン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>482<br><h1> 識 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/識%20%23kanji">Discriminating</a></h1>A person of discriminating intellect can tell the diff erence between mere kazoo－buzzing and words spoken wisely。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/識 しき">シキ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>483<br><h1> 鏡 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鏡%20%23kanji">Mirror</a></h1>After lakes but before glass、 polished metal was used for mirrors。 These metal mirrors are recalled in this character for a mirror。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鏡 きょう">キョウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鏡 かがみ">かがみ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>484<br><h1> 境 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/境%20%23kanji">Boundary</a></h1>Imagine the boundary of a plot of land marked with gigantic mirrors enabling the landowner to keep trespassers in sight at all times。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/境 きょう">キョウ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/境 けい">ケイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/境 さかい">さかい</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>485<br><h1> 亡 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亡%20%23kanji">Deceased</a></h1>A top hat hanging on a hook in the front hall、 right where the deceased left it the day he died、 reminds us of him and his kanji。 In addition to deceased、 the primitive meaning of to perish will also be used for this character。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亡 ぼう">ボウ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亡 もう">モウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亡ない">な－い</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>486<br><h1> 盲 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盲%20%23kanji">Blind</a></h1>If one’s eyes perish before death、 one remains blind for the rest of life。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盲 もう">モウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>487<br><h1> 妄 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妄%20%23kanji">Delusion</a></h1>The “ideal woman” one daydreams about is no more than a delusion。 Hence、 perish the thought of her。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妄 もう">モウ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妄 ぼう">ボウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>488<br><h1> 荒 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒%20%23kanji">Laidwaste</a></h1>The flowers that perish in the flood are taken here as symbols of an area that has been laid waste。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒 こう">コウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒あらい">あら－い</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒あれる">あ－れる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒あらす">あ－らす</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>489<br><h1> 望 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/望%20%23kanji">Ambition</a></h1>The story of ambition talks of a king walking under the perishing （or “waning”） moon dreaming great dreams about his kingdom。 （The roots of ambition are from the same word as “ambulate、” meaning to walk about。）<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/望 ぼう">ボウ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/望 もう">モウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/望のぞむ">のぞ－む</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>490<br><h1> 方 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/方%20%23kanji">Direction</a></h1>Spinning a dagger about on its hilt on the top of a top hat— waiting to see in which direction it points when it comes to rest—one leaves to fate where one is going next。 Take care in writing this character。  As a primitive、 this character will take the sense of a compass、 the instrument used to determine direction。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/方 ほう">ホウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/方 かた">かた</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>491<br><h1> 妨 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妨%20%23kanji">Disturb</a></h1>Imagine a compass that is disturbed every time a woman passes by、 sending the needle spinning madly round and round。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妨 ぼう">ボウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妨さまたげる">さまた－げる</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>492<br><h1> 坊 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/坊%20%23kanji">Boy</a></h1>The character for a boy shows us a Boy Scout cleaning the dirt out of his compass—the more dirt、 the better。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/坊 ぼう">ボウ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/坊 ぼっ">ボッ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>493<br><h1> 芳 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芳%20%23kanji">Perfumed</a></h1>Here we see a special compass used to pick out those flowers most suited for making good perfumes。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芳 ほう">ホウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芳かんばしい">かんば－しい</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>494<br><h1> 肪 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肪%20%23kanji">Obese</a></h1>If you eat too much、 you may need a compass to find your way around the obese mass of flesh that piles up in your midsection。 Compare this with the stories for round （frame 44 丸） and fat （frame 456 脂）、 similar in meaning but distinct in imagery。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肪 ぼう">ボウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>495<br><h1> 訪 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訪%20%23kanji">Call on</a></h1>When making a courtesy call on a dignitary、 one has to gauge one’s words with great care。 Hence the need for a compass。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訪 ほう">ホウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訪おとずれる">おとず－れる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訪たずねる">たず－ねる</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>496<br><h1> 放 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放%20%23kanji">Set free</a></h1>The taskmaster sets an unruly servant free、 giving him no more than a quick glance at the compass and a boot from behind。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放 ほう">ホウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放はなす">はな－す</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放はなつ">はな－つ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放はなれる">はな－れる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放ほうる">ほう－る</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>497<br><h1> 激 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/激%20%23kanji">Violent</a></h1>Some cosmic taskmaster hovering overhead whips up the waves to make them dash violently against the shore。 In the white foam that covers the water we see a broken compass floating、 all that remains of a shipwreck。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/激 げき">ゲキ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/激はげしい">はげ－しい</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>498<br><h1> 脱 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脱%20%23kanji">Undress</a></h1>To undress is to expose the flesh and tempt the devil in the eyes of one’s onlookers。 Ignore the moral if you want、 but not the devil。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脱 だつ">ダツ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脱ぬぐ">ぬ－ぐ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脱ぬげる">ぬ－げる</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>499<br><h1> 説 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/説%20%23kanji">Explanation</a></h1>Not inappropriately、 this character likens an explanation to the devil’s own words。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/説 せつ">セツ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/説 ぜい">ゼイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/説とく">と－く</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>500<br><h1> 鋭 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鋭%20%23kanji">Pointed</a></h1>Metal that has been pointed （as an awl、 a pick、 a nail、 or a knife） tends to serve the devil’s purposes as well as civilization’s： our tools are also our weapons。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鋭 えい">エイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鋭するどい">するど－い</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>501<br><h1> 曽 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曽%20%23kanji">Formerly</a></h1>This primitive （named for its associations with the kanji of the following frame） is composed of a pair of horns growing out of a brain with a tongue wagging in the mouth beneath。 Think of “former” in connection with administrators or heads of state who have just left office but continue to make a nuisance of themselves by advertising their opinions on public policy。 The primitive meaning、increase、 comes from the next frame。 Always think of something multiplying wildly as you watch。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曽 そう">ソウ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曽 ぞ">ゾ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>502<br><h1> 増 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増%20%23kanji">Increase</a></h1>This kanji depicts an increase of soil、 multiplying so fast that it literally buries everything in its path。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増 ぞう">ゾウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増ます">ま－す</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増ふえる">ふ－える</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増ふやす">ふ－やす</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>503<br><h1> 贈 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/贈%20%23kanji">Presents</a></h1>The presents off ered here are money that increases each time you give it away。 Do not confuse with the temporal word “present” （frame 259 現）。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/贈 ぞう">ゾウ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/贈 そう">ソウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/贈おくる">おく－る</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>504<br><h1> 東 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/東%20%23kanji">East</a></h1>As a “Western” language、 English identifies the east with the rising sun。 In more fanciful terms、 we see the sun piercing through a tree as it rises in the east。  Both the direction east and the part of the world called “the East” are primitive meanings of this character。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/東 とう">トウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/東 ひがし">ひがし</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>505<br><h1> 棟 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/棟%20%23kanji">Ridgepole</a></h1>If the piece of wood in the roof known as the ridgepole points east、 the sunrise will be visible from the front door。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/棟 とう">トウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/棟 むね">むね</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/棟 むな">むな</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>506<br><h1> 凍 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/凍%20%23kanji">Frozen</a></h1>The whole secret to breaking the ice with the East is to peek behind those mysteriously “frozen smiles。” <br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/凍 とう">トウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/凍こおる">こお－る</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/凍こごえる">こご－える</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>507<br><h1> 妊 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妊%20%23kanji">Pregnancy</a></h1>A woman who is in her pregnancy is a bit like a porter、 bearing her new companion wherever she goes。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妊 にん">ニン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>508<br><h1> 廷 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/廷%20%23kanji">Courts</a></h1>Those who rule the courts、 the porters of justice and order、 are often found to stretch the law to suit their own purposes。 Recall the kanji for prolong from frame 392 延 and keep it distinct。 part three Elements We come now to the third major step in our study of the kanji： the invention of plots from primitive elements。 From now on、 the ordering of the remaining characters according to their primitives will be taken care of、 but the reader will be required to do most of the work。 As before、 particularly difficult kanji will be supplied with supplementary hints、 plots、 or even whole stories。 You should now have a feel for the way details can be worked into a kanji story so as to create a more vivid ambience for the primitive elements to interact。 What may be more difficult is experimenting with plots and discarding them until the simplest one is fixed on、 and then embellished and nuanced。 You may find it helpful occasionally to study some of the earlier stories that you found especially impressive、 in order to discover precisely why they struck you、 and then to imitate their vitality in the stories you will now be inventing。 Equally helpful will be any attention you give to those characters whose stories you have found it difficult to remember、 or have easily confused with those of other characters。 As you progress through this final section、 you may wish even to return and amend some of those earlier stories。 But do it with the knowledge that once a story has been learned、 it is generally better to review it and perhaps repair it slightly than to discard it entirely and start over。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/廷 てい">テイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>509<br><h1> 染 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/染%20%23kanji">Dye</a></h1>Water 。 。 。 nine 。 。 。 tree。 From those elements you must compose a plot for the key word、 dye。 Here、 as elsewhere、 any of the alternate meanings of the primitives may be used、 provided they do not require a position other than that of the kanji in question。 <br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/染 せん">セン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/染そめる">そ－める</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/染そまる">そ－まる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/染しみる">し－みる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/染しみ">し－み</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>510<br><h1> 燃 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/燃%20%23kanji">Burn</a></h1>Hearth 。 。 。 sort of thing。 Beware of letting the simple reading off of the primitive elements do your work for you。 Unless you make a vivid image of something burning and relate it just as vividly to those primitive meanings、 you can count on forgetting this character very quickly。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/燃 ねん">ネン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/燃もえる">も－える</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/燃もやす">も－やす</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/燃もす">も－す</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>511<br><h1> 賓 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賓%20%23kanji">V。i。p。</a></h1> The v。i。p。 indicated here is an important guest making a visit。 The elements are： house 。 。 。 ceiling 。 。 。 few 。 。 。 shells。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賓 ひん">ヒン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>512<br><h1> 歳 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歳%20%23kanji">Year－end</a></h1>Stop 。 。 。 march 。 。 。 little。 Be sure not to forget that final dot in the element for march。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歳 さい">サイ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歳 せい">セイ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>513<br><h1> 県 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/県%20%23kanji">Prefecture</a></h1>Above、 an eye and a fishhook、 and below the primitive for little。 Although apparently the simplest of these first six kanji、 when you begin to work on its plot and story you will soon find out that the number of strokes and visual complexity of a kanji does not make it easier or harder to remember。 It is the primitives you have to work that are the critical factor、 as in this case where the meaning of the key word is so seemingly distant from the elements。 Remember、 you can always break larger elements down （eye of a needle into eye and fishhook） if you think it helps。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/県 けん">ケン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>514<br><h1> 栃 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/栃%20%23kanji">Horse chestnut</a></h1>A tree 。 。 。 cliff 。 。 。 ten thousand。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/栃 とち">とち</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>515<br><h1> 地 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/地%20%23kanji">Ground</a></h1>Soil and a scorpion （an “earth animal”）。 This is、 of course、 the full character from which the primitive for ground derives。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/地 ち">チ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/地 じ">ジ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>516<br><h1> 池 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/池%20%23kanji">Pond</a></h1>Water 。 。 。 scorpion。 It would be easy to slip into a “lazy image” in cases like this one、 picturing、 let us say、 a scorpion near the water。 But if you picture rather a scorpion letting its venom out drop by drop until it has made a whole pond of the stuff 、 the image is more likely to remain fixed。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/池 ち">チ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/池 いけ">いけ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>517<br><h1> 虫 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/虫%20%23kanji">Insect</a></h1>Work with the pictograph as you wish。  As a primitive、 this insect will refer to the whole insect kingdom；、 it can be specified for each kanji that contains it。－<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/虫 ちゅう">チュウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/虫 むし">むし</a></div>

<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>525<br><h1> 己 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/己%20%23kanji">Self</a></h1>The kanji carries the abstract sense of the self、 the deep－down inner structure of the human person that mythology has often depicted as a snake—which is what the kanji shows pictographically。 Be sure to keep it distinct from the similar key words、 oneself （frame 36 自） and I （frame 17 吾）。  As a primitive element、 this kanji can be used for the snake— of which it is a pictograph—or any of the various concrete sym bolic meanings the snake has in myth and fable。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/己 こ">コ</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/己 き">キ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/己 おのれ">おのれ</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>526<br><h1> 起 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/起%20%23kanji">Rouse</a></h1>Run 。 。 。 snake。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/起 き">キ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/起おきる">お－きる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/起おこる">お－こる</a>, <a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/起おこす">お－こす</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>527<br><h1> 妃 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妃%20%23kanji">Queen</a></h1>Woman 。 。 。 snake。 <br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妃 ひ">ヒ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>

<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>529<br><h1> 記 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/記%20%23kanji">Scribe</a></h1>Words 。 。 。 snake。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/記 き">キ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/記しるす">しる－す</a></div>
<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>530<br><h1> 包 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/包%20%23kanji">Wrap</a></h1>Bind up 。 。 。 snake。  The primitive meaning of wrap should always be used with the snake in mind to avoid confusion with similar terms。Just let “wrap” mean “with a snake coiled about it。”<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/包 ほう">ホウ</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/包つつむ">つつ－む</a></div>

<style> .mainone { background-color: black; color: white; } .mainone a { color: white; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone a:hover { color:gray; font-size: 1.5em; } .mainone h1 { background-color: black; } .mainone h2 { background-color: orange; width: 50%; margin: auto; } </style><div class = "mainone"><br>535<br><h1> 電 </h1></div>	<div class = "mainone"><h1><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/電%20%23kanji">Electricity</a></h1>Rain／weather 。 。 。 eel。<br><br><h2>Onyomi</h2><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/電 でん">デン</a><br><br><h2>Kunyomi</h2></div>
